alert.note: Alert for Nacogdoches; Rusk (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 8:11AM CDT until March 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Texas... East Fork Angelina River Near Cushing affecting Nacogdoches and Rusk Counties. For the East Fork Angelina River...including Cushing...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork Angelina River Near Cushing, Texas. * WHEN...From this Tuesday morning to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 15 feet, Minor lowland flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The East Fork is expected to rise to a crest of 15.1 feet during this Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage by late this Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 945 AM CDT.
